alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Catoosa, central Walker and central Dade Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Chattanooga Valley, or 8 miles east of Trenton, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Fort Oglethorpe, Chickamauga, La Fayette, Chattanooga Valley, Rising Fawn, Noble, Fairview, Linwood, Chattanooga Valley, Morganville, Cloudland Canyon State Park, and Cooper Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
